column3: Oh, Phoebe, are you still on hold
I was supposed to call my Dad back like two hours ago
Oh, yeah, he clipped on, he said call him as soon as you get a chance, he’s at Flimby’s
Oh, yeah, that’s the word I use when I can’t remember the real thing
Rachel, that’s what they want me to do
My warranty expires tomorrow, if I don’t get through, they’re not gonna fix my crappy, broken phone for free
Uh, listen I gotta double check for tickets tonight
Uh, yeah, I ah, I also need two
One of the more difficult games sewer workers play
Uh, no, it’s-it’s just this person
I hope that won’t be too weird
No, not at all, not at all
I actually was gonna bring someone myself, so…
Did ah, you guys mean you plus one
All right, I’ll see you tonight
Oh, hey, you guys are finally gonna get to meet Kate
And I ah, borrowed some of your cologne
It’s never gonna happen, she’s seeing somebody
Yeah, and I don’t have any cologne
The green bottle next to the shaving cream
Ooh, I’m setting the phone down
Just don’t go anywhere I’m still here
Don’t-don’t switch or anything, ‘cause I’m, I’m right here
Your call is important to us
Okay, wait, you gotta hang up ‘cause we’re gonna be late
Thank you for your patience, you’re the next caller
You were gonna have me hang up
Can you take a duck and a chick to the theatre
I just wanted them to hear it from somebody else
So it’s looks like we’re the first ones here
Oh, I’m sorry, this is Cailin
Okay, uhh, I think I’m going to run to the ladies room
So uh, well, this-this is uh, this is awkward
Well y'know ‘cause Rachel and I used to go out
Oh, I didn’t, I didn’t know that
Excuse me, I’m sorry, I-I think you may be in our seats
Umm, no, I don’t think so
Can-can we take a look at your ticket
Yeah, see this says D-13, and uh…
Oh, well I thought that ah…
Yeah, well that didn’t really work out too well for you did it you idiot
Look you’re surrounded by even numbers
Did that give you some clue
Uh, the usher told us to come…
What, with all that training they go through
Hey man, you want the aisle
Almost as good as that play with the two naked girls on the see-saw
Listen I want you to meet everybody
So that’s the girl you like
I’m telling you, this guy Rachel is with is crazy
He viscously screamed at total strangers
Wait a minute, wait a minute, you don’t like the guy Rachel’s dating
Uh, you guys this is, this is Kate’s understudy, Lauren
I-I ran into you in the hallway in your building
It was right after I slept with Joey
He dumped me the next day
Well ah, the short version is, I ah pursued her for a couple of months, then I gave her a check for 20,000 dollars, and she was mine
Yeah, and in the long version, I dump him for telling people the short version
Hey you guys, this is my agent, Estelle
Ooh, you two girls were outstanding
No, they-they weren’t in the play
Because with her face  and her chest  I could really put something together
Tommy’s in line for the bathroom and someone just cut in front of him, I think he’s gonna snap
Could be because I don’t feel like standing around all night waiting for some guy who may or may not scream
But-but Cailin, he definitely will scream
The Lucille Lortel Theatre, blah-la-la-la… Ah-ha
Joey Tribianni, gives an uneven performance, but Mr
Tribianni is not the worst thing in this production
Kate Miller’s awkward and mannered portrayal is laughable
The direction by Marshal Talmant is…  Thank you, boys and girls, you’ve ruined my life
Please, stuff your talentless faces with my Mother’s crab cakes
Anyone mind if I save this
Thank you for your patience, you’re the next caller
You were the next caller five hours ago
I put your stuff in her room, and her stuff in your room
Listen, drama critics they’re nothing but, but people who couldn’t make it as actors
You know what you should do
A plague on both your houses
By the way, he dumped me tonight after he read my review
I sure know how to pick ‘em, huh
Y'know I gave up a part on a soap for this
Yeah I ah, I gave up a job too
We’ll stop by every news stand and burn every copy of their Times and the Post
Oh, you didn’t see the Post
So you really think those newspapers are just jealous of me
You’re talented and you’re good looking
Wait a minute, wait a minute
I mean first, you hate me
Then you want nothing to do with me, now you want me again
So you never went out with an actress before
Kate, do you even like me
Well so, how come you blew me off
How come you were with him
I-I always have to pick the like the smartest guy, or-or the most talented guy… Why can’t I just pick someone like you
I mean like the sweetest guy
Joey, you’re just so, you’re so, so…
There we go, let’s get your feet up there
I’m gonna put this can right here in case you have to hurl
You’re call is very important to us
Pheebs, you’ve been up for 24 hours
No, no, I’m fine, and y’know why
Didn’t you have that outfit on last night
I stayed at Kate’s, but ah, nothing happened
I’m so, so, so sorry, Joey
I definitely am gonna see you’re play
I swear you’re play is very important to us, thank you for your patience
You’re play is the next play is the next play I’m gonna see
Anyway, how did it go with Kate
Yeah, I-I walked her home, and it was amazing how much we connected, y'know
Then ah, then she passed out, but then she woke up
And we stayed up all night talking, and now we’re like totally crazy about each other
When two people finally realise their feelings for each other, and-and they talk for hours, and they-they learn all about the other person
Did you like learn about her family
This is from the woman at the bar
She thought you were somebody else
Tommy’s supposed to be here soon, we’re going to lunch
Look, I wasn’t going to say anything to you, but
All right, I don’t think you should be seeing Tommy anymore
I think you should stay away from him
Umm, or, maybe, I should stay away from all men
No, it’s not just ‘cause I’m jealous
I mean I’m not, I’m not, I’m not jealous, okay
It’s… Look, the guy, he screamed, he actually screamed at this couple sitting in our seats
Yeah, and at the end of the play, he, he got up y'know, and he just started like,  banging his hands together
You don’t want to believe me
You don’t want to believe me, I’m Mr
You were gonna spill hot coffee all over me, huh
What are you just some big, dumb, stupid, doofy idiot, with a doofy idiot hairdo, huh
What’s your favourite thing about summertime
When it stays light real late
Say, what’s your favourite thing about summer
Probably the smell of freshly cut grass
Sorry, I’m late; sorry, I’m late
My duck and my chick and a fight, it-it was ugly
Look, we held the curtain for you buddy
She got a job in L
I’ve been waiting up all night for ya
Oh, ahh, go to the window
I’m wanna run down to the truck and show you something
What do you got down there, Vic
What do you got under that tarp
Hey, mind if I use the phone
Why don’t you use ours across the hall, ‘cause she…has…problems
I almost spilled this hot coffee on you
Ross, would you just stop it
I can’t believe no one believes me
But I also believed her  when she said I was next
Oh look at me, I’m so cute, I’m a little chick who’s disgusting
God, you’re so stupid, how are you not yet extinct
Chic-A-Dee, sorry you went doody in my hand
Well, I guess we’re not going out anymore
I’m soo glad I caught you, I couldn’t find you before
They still want me for General Hospital
But I-I can’t stay here just for you
Well, so, stay for the museums
Well can you at least stay to the end of the play
I mean, I’ll go to the airport with ya, I-I wanna say good bye
Listen, I ah, I gotta say good bye, and-and I gotta say it quick ‘cause this is killing me
One thing you gotta know, is that I will never forget you
But, you’ve got things you have to do now, and so do I
And so… I’m gonna get on this spaceship,  and I’m gonna go to Blargon 7 in search of alternative fuels
But when I return, 200 years from now, you’ll be long gone
But I won’t have aged at all
So you tell your great-great-granddaughter to look me up, because Adrienne, baby, I’m gonna want to meet her
Oh, good thing it’s one of those 801 numbers
Phoebe, 800 is toll free, 801 is-is Utah
No, no, no, oh no-no-no, it’s has to be 800
‘Cause all those big companies have 800 numbers, every one
Yeah, every big Utah-based company has one
Sorry, I’m so sorry, I will pay you back
And yet, she’s still not hanging up the phone
Well, I think I broke it
But that’s all right, here’s the number you can call
